page.title: 13Austerfield Field Centre
page.content: The centre was built in 1882 as the village school and at the turn of the century had 60 pupils.The school was closed in 1973 with the end of the West Riding of Yorkshire and Austerfield children now travel to school in Bawtry or Finningly. All aspects of the local environment can be studied including its history, geology and ecology.There are 2 full time teachers and a technician on the staff.The original building is used as classrooms and a field behind serves as a campsite.One outside classroom is the camper's dining room while another,larger mobile room is used to house a variety of animals such as snakes,spiders,rats ,gerbils,terrapins and guineapigs.Moths,butterflies and caterpillars from the neighbouring sand quarries are studied as are frogs and toads.
